metadata.md:title: College Physics
metadata.md:abstract: This introductory, algebra-based, two-semester college physics book is grounded with real-world examples, illustrations, and explanations to help students grasp key, fundamental physics concepts. This online, fully editable and customizable title includes learning objectives, concept questions, links to labs and simulations, and ample practice opportunities to solve traditional physics application problems.

col:subcollection.md:title: Introduction: The Nature of Science and Physics

col:module.md:title: Introduction to Science and the Realm of Physics, Physical Quantities, and Units
Motion Equations for Constant Acceleration in One Dimension
Kinematics in Two Dimensions: An Introduction
Vector Addition and Subtraction: Graphical Methods
Vector Addition and Subtraction: Analytical Methods

col:subcollection.md:title: Dynamics: Force and Newton's Laws of Motion

col:module.md:title: Introduction to Dynamics: Newton’s Laws of Motion
Newton’s First Law of Motion: Inertia
Newton’s Second Law of Motion: Concept of a System
Newton’s Third Law of Motion: Symmetry in Forces
Normal, Tension, and Other Examples of Forces
Further Applications of Newton’s Laws of Motion
Extended Topic: The Four Basic Forces—An Introduction

col:subcollection.md:title: Further Applications of Newton's Laws: Friction, Drag, and Elasticity

col:module.md:title: Introduction: Further Applications of Newton’s Laws
Introduction to Uniform Circular Motion and Gravitation
Fictitious Forces and Non-inertial Frames: The Coriolis Force
Satellites and Kepler’s Laws: An Argument for Simplicity
Introduction to Work, Energy, and Energy Resources
Kinetic Energy and the Work-Energy Theorem
Work, Energy, and Power in Humans
Introduction to Linear Momentum and Collisions

Applications of Statics, Including Problem-Solving Strategies
Forces and Torques in Muscles and Joints
Introduction to Rotational Motion and Angular Momentum
Dynamics of Rotational Motion: Rotational Inertia
Rotational Kinetic Energy: Work and Energy Revisited
Collisions of Extended Bodies in Two Dimensions
Gyroscopic Effects: Vector Aspects of Angular Momentum
Variation of Pressure with Depth in a Fluid
Gauge Pressure, Absolute Pressure, and Pressure Measurement
Cohesion and Adhesion in Liquids: Surface Tension and Capillary Action

col:subcollection.md:title: Fluid Dynamics and Its Biological and Medical Applications

col:module.md:title: Introduction to Fluid Dynamics and Its Biological and Medical Applications

col:subcollection.md:title: Temperature, Kinetic Theory, and the Gas Laws

col:module.md:title: Introduction to Temperature, Kinetic Theory, and the Gas Laws
Thermal Expansion of Solids and Liquids
Kinetic Theory: Atomic and Molecular Explanation of Pressure and Temperature
Introduction to Heat and Heat Transfer Methods
The First Law of Thermodynamics and Some Simple Processes

Carnot’s Perfect Heat Engine: The Second Law of Thermodynamics Restated
Applications of Thermodynamics: Heat Pumps and Refrigerators

Statistical Interpretation of Entropy and the Second Law of Thermodynamics: The Underlying Explanation

Hooke’s Law: Stress and Strain Revisited
Simple Harmonic Motion: A Special Periodic Motion
Energy and the Simple Harmonic Oscillator
Uniform Circular Motion and Simple Harmonic Motion
Introduction to the Physics of Hearing
Speed of Sound, Frequency, and Wavelength
Sound Interference and Resonance: Standing Waves in Air Columns

Static Electricity and Charge: Conservation of Charge
Electric Field: Concept of a Field Revisited
Conductors and Electric Fields in Static Equilibrium
Introduction to Electric Potential and Electric Energy

col:subcollection.md:title: Electric Current, Resistance, and Ohm's Law

col:module.md:title: Introduction to Electric Current, Resistance, and Ohm's Law
Ohm’s Law: Resistance and Simple Circuits

Introduction to Circuits and DC Instruments
